ai.summary: A challenging 26.3 km circuit at Knepp Wildland in the UK. The Red Route combines open downs, hedgerow paths, and woodland tracks for a demanding day hike with variable terrain and wildlife viewing opportunities.
ai.terrain_summary: The route traverses open grassland, gravel bridleways, muddy in-field paths, woodland edges, and occasional road sections. Expect uneven footing, potential mud after rain, cattle grids, and exposed, windy sections on the downs.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day: 26.3 km with significant elevation. Check the forecast and daylight hours. Carry a map and compass (or GPS), and know your limits. Stay on marked paths, and be mindful of livestock; give cattle space and avoid disturbing birds and other wildlife. Bring enough water (2–3 L) and high-energy snacks. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and layers; weather can change quickly. Mobile signal may be limited; tell someone your route and ETA. Carry a whistle and basic first aid, plus a light source if you may be out near dusk.
recommended_gear: Warm layers and hat/gloves for wind
Mobile phone with offline maps and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly late March to October) when daylight is longer and conditions are more forgiving; summer offers better visibility of wildlife, while late autumn and early spring can be damp and muddy.

seo.title: Knepp Wildland Red Route – 26.3 km UK hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Knepp Wildland Red Route, a hard 26.3 km hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety, best seasons, and gear for this demanding day on the Knepp Estate.
seo.h1: Knepp Wildland Red Route – 26.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
